page.title: 07 KINGSWEAR LOWER FERRY
page.content: There has been a ferry in Kingswear for a long time.The first ferry was probably a rowing boat.The first record of the ferry was in 1805.It is now owned by South Hams District Council. The Lower Car Ferry crosses between Dartmouth and Kingswear.The ferry really is a float with a tug that pulls it across the river.The float can fit two rows of four cars and 65 people on.When the ferry is empty it can carry 100 people.The car ferry crosses the river eight times an hour for 16 hours a day. In July and August nearly 1000 cars cross each day. To cross the river it costs: 15pence for children,25 pence for adults,Â£1.15 for cars. { Katherine Bovey,Kate Cooke.
